sources.title: Too Late for Tears (1949) [Colorized, 4k, 60fps]
sources.description: Too Late for Tears is a 1949  black and white movie film which has been colorised, upscaled to 4K, and frames per second boosted to 60 FPS in 2021 using Artificial Intelligence (A.I) and Google Colab @ https://colab.research.google.com/  Technologies used: A.I. Colorizing: https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify A.I. Increasing frame rate 60 FPS: https://rife-vfi.github.io  A.I. Upscaling to 4K: https://ffmpeg.org  GPU: Google Colab Google Colaboratory https://colab.research.google.com jantic/DeOldify https://github.com

sources.title: Too Late For Tears (1949) [P&M] 720p Blu-Ray (700MB)
sources.description: For the P&M collection, I scour the web for the highest fidelity uploads of films, whether that be here on the Archive, elsewhere on the web, on bittorrent or even YouTube. When the highest quality version I've found isn't available on the Archive, I upload it! These are often much larger files than what are typically on the Archive, but, if you're like me, this may be no issue for you.

sources.title: Too Late for Tears (1949) DAN DURYEA
sources.description:
Stars: Lizabeth Scott, Dan Duryea, Don DeFore
Director: Byron Haskin

 Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and is determined to hold onto it even it if means murder!

metadata.Plot: One night on a lonely highway, a man in a speeding car tosses a satchel of money meant for somebody else into Jane and Alan Palmer's convertible as they are heading down a mountain road to a party. When they open the satchel and see what's inside, Alan wants to turn it over to the police, but Jane, with a life of luxury now within reach, persuades him to hang onto it "for a while." Soon afterward, the Palmers are tracked down by one Danny Fuller, a sleazy character who claims the money is his. To hang on to the cash, Jane will need to exercise all her feminine wiles, even if it leads her to dangerous circumstances and criminal behavior.
metadata.Actors: Lizabeth Scott, Don DeFore, Dan Duryea
